items.text: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

items.text: I waited patiently for the LORD; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
items.plainText: I waited patiently for the LORD; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.

items.text: He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.
items.plainText: He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.

items.text: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God: many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the LORD.
items.plainText: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God: many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the LORD.

items.text: Blessed is that man that maketh the LORD his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
items.plainText: Blessed is that man that maketh the LORD his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

items.text: Many, O LORD my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.
items.plainText: Many, O LORD my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.

items.text: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.
items.plainText: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.

items.text: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,
items.plainText: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,

items.text: I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
items.plainText: I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.

items.text: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O LORD, thou knowest.
items.plainText: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O LORD, thou knowest.

items.text: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.
items.plainText: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.

items.text: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O LORD: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.
items.plainText: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O LORD: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.

items.text: For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.
items.plainText: For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.

items.text: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me: O LORD, make haste to help me.
items.plainText: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me: O LORD, make haste to help me.

items.text: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.
items.plainText: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.

items.text: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.
items.plainText: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.

items.text: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The LORD be magnified.
items.plainText: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The LORD be magnified.

items.text: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.
items.plainText: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.
